title: Metal Type
content:
Hi,

Can anyone identify these two metal typefaces? I don't think they are American as they aren't in McGrew's book.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [type specimen 1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020074318/http:/typophile.com/files/type%20specimen%201.jpg) | 45.83 KB |
| [type specimens 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020074318/http:/typophile.com/files/type%20specimens%202.jpg) | 35.44 KB |
author: Shrdlu

comments.content: The second is Houtsneeletter by A Van der Vossen for Enschedé, 1927. Digitized poorly by Fontbank years ago as [Tarzan](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020074318/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/tarzan.htm) (and Brendel as Mahogani).
Nah. Houtsneeletter is rather, well ... distinctive. See it once and you recognize it later. Nice to see you here, Akira.
